sentence: The Home Depot Inc. ( HD ), the world's largest home improvement retailer, released fourth-quarter fiscal 2014 results, wherein adjusted earnings of $1.00 a share came ahead of the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 89 cents.
Moreover, the bottom line jumped nearly 37% from 73 cents a share earned in the year-ago quarter.
Driven by the ongoing strength in U.S. dollar, the company expects its fiscal 2015 sales and earnings to bear a negative impact of about $1 billion and 6 cents per share, respectively.
As a result, sales are expected to increase in the range of 3.5%-4.7%, with comparable store sales growth of 3.3%-4.5%.
Earnings per share is projected in the range of $5.11-$5.17, representing a growth of 8.5%-10%.
Earnings Estimate Revision: The Zacks Consensus Estimate remains stable in the last 60 days.
However, Home Depot's performance in fiscal 2014 remains encouraging.
The company has posted positive earnings surprises of 2%, 5.6% and 1.8% in the first, second and third quarters of 2014, respectively.
Moreover, the company delivered a positive earnings surprise of 12.4% in the quarter under review.
In the trailing four quarters, including the quarter under review, the company outperformed the Zacks Consensus Estimate by an average of 3.6%.
Revenues: Home Depot's net sales increased 8.3% year over year to $19,162 million but surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $18,672 million.
Comparable store sales increased 7.9%.
The company's results gained from strength across its stores, the recovering U.S. housing market and solid execution.
Key Events: Home Depot declared a 26% increase in its quarterly dividend to 59 cents per share, payable on Mar 26 to shareholders with record as on Mar 12.
The company also authorized an $18.0 billion share repurchase program, in place of its existing authorization.
Zacks Rank: Currently, Home Depot carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) which is subject to change following the earnings announcement.
Check back later for our full write up on Home Depot's earnings report!
